ygData.subject: Please read this OOC
ygData.msgSnippet: I understand people being upset about Minime, and JP s comments concerning him.  However as I sit here and read my mail, I see the group being polarized.  This

Received: from Rudra656@... by imo-d07.mx.aol.com (mail_out_v29.5.) id r.c5.da1e868 (4539) for <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>; Fri, 2 Feb 2001 21:32:56 -0500 (EST)
Message-ID: <c5.da1e868.27acc7d8@...>
Date: Fri, 2 Feb 2001 21:32:56 EST
Subject: Please read this OOC
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Mailer: AOL 5.0 for Windows sub 129
From: Rudra656@...

    I understand people being upset about Minime, and JP's comments 
concerning him.  However as I sit here and read my mail, I see the group 
being polarized.  This deeply upsets me.

    I did not know Minime well.  In fact I hardly, if ever interacted with 
him.  However we were instructed to remember him.  Do we honor this memory by 
arguing amongst ourselves?  Will we slowly drive the members of this group 
away until we run out of targets and turn against each other?  Or will we 
stop the senseless bickering, honor him with a day of silence, and continue 
on mourning and remembering in our own ways?
